categories.title: Consensus check
categories.about: The purpose of the Consensus Check is to establish formal discussion around a potential proposal.

categories.title: Delegation pitch
categories.about: Explain why members of the Uniswap community may want to delegate their votes to you!

categories.title: Site feedback
categories.about: Discussion about this site, its organization, how it works, and how we can improve it.

categories.title: Uncategorized
categories.about: Topics that don't need a category, or don't fit into any other existing category.

discussions.author: 0x72c7f49Ae7b664CC09f6891b68eedB08aA2FC15b
discussions.title: Deploy Uniswap v3 on Moonbeam (2023)
discussions.content:
We Michigan Blockchain 13 are submitting this proposal to reinstate the deployment of Uniswap v3 on Polkadot’s EVM-compatible parachain, Moonbeam.

Last spring, the Uniswap DAO voted on this exact topic. The proposal advanced through Uni’s governance rails, receiving positive feedback from the community 1, progressing past the temperate check 4, and eventually passing with a near unanimous YES decision during the onchain vote 4. Nomad was the designated contract deployer and the appointed cross-chain messaging solution for that proposal. Illusory Systems (Nomad) received the Additional Use Grant, which can be seen on the v3-core-license-grants.uniswap.eth ENS subdomain 3.

discussions.author: 0xa872C2133e16705f54ee816C430cad6e6a299bB9
discussions.title: What do you think of the initial airdrop?
discussions.content:
As you know, six months have passed since the airdrop. What do you think about it:

Was it positive for the project?
Have you achieved the initial objectives of the Governance group?
Did the number of users increase?
-It has been a success?
Should it be repeated when it is one year old?
In my opinion, all the answers are yes. I hope many have the same opinion.

I await your comments
A hug to all

discussions.author: 0x14Ff0Bc9417B6796f79768729002A793b51205B8
discussions.title: Gauntlet: Delegation Migration / Consolidation
discussions.content:
Hi all,

If we haven’t met, I head up Gauntlet’s 12 governance platform. I’m posting here with the hope that this reaches the relevant parties.

As it stands, Gauntlet currently has two addresses that have UNI delegated to it:
EOA: 0x6626593C237f530D15aE9980A95ef938Ac15c35c 5
Multi-Sig: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02 4

We’re in the process of consolidating all delegations to one address (multi-sig). If you are currently delegating to the EOA, we are asking you to re-delegate to the multi-sig address.

If you have any questions, feel free to DM me here or on Twitter (@mattdobel, @gauntletnetwork).

Thanks for your support.

replies.author: 0xD299F46b223ba3047FEC3bA1D6D19f96D4f52127
replies.content: Many thanks @litocoen for this proposal - much appreciated! Combined with @Milli3E‘s suggestion to consider / include LUSD as the most decentralized stablecoin, it‘s a wholehearted YES!

replies.author: 0x7f3c703cBcd18acf9B2D85BC4b59a770d2307Ae6
replies.content:
I find this suggestion very clever thanks @guil-lambert!

I would have no objection against implementing the liquidity mining program this way.

replies.author: 0x830fB488E3Da47f2b12feeDE6AF5D00F1Eaa136A
replies.content:
These look like great thorough write-ups!

Are the recent “Just in Time” liquidity attacks going to be gameable with the discussed implementations?
